insights.title: Youth Homelessness Statistics
insights.description: In New York City, approximately 1 in 10 public school students experienced homelessness during the 2022-23 school year. This amounts to nearly 104,000 students.

insights.title: Geographic Distribution
insights.description: The Bronx has the highest rate of student homelessness at 1 in 7 students, followed by Manhattan (1 in 8), Brooklyn (1 in 11), Queens (1 in 14), and Staten Island (1 in 25).

insights.title: Historical Trends
insights.description: The number of homeless students in NYC has increased by 71% since 2010. Over 200,000 students have experienced homelessness over the past five years.

insights.title: Shelter System Impact
insights.description: More than 30,000 students lived in NYC shelters during the 2022-23 school year. Additionally, about 28,000 students lived doubled-up in temporary housing situations.

insights.title: Educational Impact
insights.description: Students experiencing homelessness have lower graduation rates and higher chronic absenteeism rates compared to their permanently housed peers.
